articles.title: Subject-matter and objectives
articles.summary: This Regulation lays down rules relating to the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and rules relating to the free movement of personal data.
requirements: Protect fundamental rights and freedoms of natural persons, particularly the right to protection of personal data
Ensure free movement of personal data within the Union

articles.title: Material scope
articles.summary: This Regulation applies to the processing of personal data wholly or partly by automated means and to other processing.
requirements: Applies to automated processing of personal data
Applies to non-automated processing if part of a filing system

articles.title: Principles relating to processing of personal data
articles.summary: Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner; collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes; adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary; accurate and kept up to date; kept in a form which permits identification for no longer than necessary; processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security.
requirements: Lawfulness, fairness and transparency: Process data lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner
Purpose limitation: Collect data for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes only
Data minimisation: Ensure data is adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary
Accuracy: Keep personal data accurate and up to date
Storage limitation: Keep data in identifiable form only as long as necessary
Integrity and confidentiality: Process data securely using appropriate technical and organisational measures
Accountability: Controller shall be responsible for and able to demonstrate compliance

articles.title: Lawfulness of processing
articles.summary: Processing shall be lawful only if at least one legal basis applies: consent, contract, legal obligation, vital interests, public task, or legitimate interests.
requirements: Obtain consent from the data subject
Processing necessary for performance of a contract
Processing necessary for compliance with legal obligation
Processing necessary to protect vital interests
Processing necessary for public interest or official authority
Processing necessary for legitimate interests (except where overridden by data subject interests)

domains.title: Chapter III - Rights of the Data Subject

articles.title: Transparent information, communication and modalities
articles.summary: Controller shall take appropriate measures to provide information in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.
requirements: Provide information in concise, transparent, intelligible form
Use clear and plain language
Respond to requests without undue delay, within one month
Provide information free of charge

articles.title: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject
articles.summary: Where personal data are collected from the data subject, controller shall provide identity, contact details, purposes, legal basis, recipients, retention period, rights, right to withdraw consent, right to lodge complaint.
requirements: Provide controller identity and contact details
Provide Data Protection Officer contact details
Provide purposes and legal basis for processing
Disclose legitimate interests (if applicable)
Identify recipients or categories of recipients
Disclose international transfers
Specify retention period
Inform of data subject rights (access, rectification, erasure, restriction, portability, objection)
Inform of right to withdraw consent
Inform of right to lodge complaint with supervisory authority
State whether provision of data is statutory, contractual requirement, or necessary
Disclose automated decision-making including profiling

articles.title: Right of access by the data subject
articles.summary: Data subject shall have the right to obtain confirmation as to whether personal data are being processed, and access to the personal data and information.
requirements: Confirm whether personal data is being processed
Provide access to personal data
Provide copy of personal data undergoing processing
Provide information about processing purposes, categories, recipients, retention period, rights, complaint rights, source of data, automated decision-making

articles.title: Right to rectification
articles.summary: Data subject shall have the right to obtain rectification of inaccurate personal data and completion of incomplete personal data.
requirements: Rectify inaccurate personal data without undue delay
Complete incomplete personal data

articles.title: Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')
articles.summary: Data subject shall have the right to obtain erasure of personal data without undue delay where grounds apply.
requirements: Erase data when no longer necessary for purposes
Erase data when consent is withdrawn
Erase data when data subject objects and no overriding legitimate grounds exist
Erase data when processed unlawfully
Erase data to comply with legal obligation
Inform other controllers processing the data about erasure request

articles.title: Right to restriction of processing
articles.summary: Data subject shall have the right to obtain restriction of processing in specific circumstances.
requirements: Restrict processing when accuracy is contested
Restrict processing when processing is unlawful but erasure is opposed
Restrict processing when no longer needed but required for legal claims
Restrict processing when objection is pending verification

articles.title: Right to data portability
articles.summary: Data subject shall have the right to receive personal data in structured, commonly used, machine-readable format and transmit to another controller.
requirements: Provide data in structured, commonly used, machine-readable format
Allow transmission of data to another controller where technically feasible

articles.title: Right to object
articles.summary: Data subject shall have the right to object to processing of personal data based on legitimate interests, public interest, or for direct marketing.
requirements: Allow objection to processing based on legitimate interests or public interest
Allow objection to direct marketing at any time
Cease processing upon objection unless compelling legitimate grounds exist

articles.title: Responsibility of the controller
articles.summary: Controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure and demonstrate compliance with this Regulation (accountability).
requirements: Implement appropriate technical and organisational measures
Demonstrate compliance with GDPR (accountability principle)
Review and update measures when necessary
Implement data protection by design and by default

articles.title: Data protection by design and by default
articles.summary: Controller shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures designed to implement data protection principles and integrate safeguards into processing.
requirements: Implement data protection by design (at time of determining means of processing)
Implement data protection by default (ensure only necessary personal data is processed)
Apply pseudonymisation where appropriate
Minimise processing of personal data
Ensure transparency regarding functions and processing

articles.title: Processor
articles.summary: Processor shall only act on documented instructions from controller and implement appropriate technical and organisational measures.
requirements: Process data only on documented instructions from controller
Ensure persons processing data are bound by confidentiality
Implement appropriate technical and organisational measures (Article 32)
Engage sub-processors only with controller authorization
Assist controller in ensuring compliance with Articles 32-36
Delete or return personal data after end of services
Make available information necessary to demonstrate compliance

articles.title: Records of processing activities
articles.summary: Controller and processor shall maintain records of processing activities under their responsibility.
requirements: Maintain record of processing activities including: name and contact details, purposes, categories of data subjects and personal data, categories of recipients, international transfers, retention periods, security measures
Make records available to supervisory authority on request

articles.title: Security of processing
articles.summary: Controller and processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk.
requirements: Implement pseudonymisation and encryption of personal data
Ensure ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems
Restore availability and access to data in timely manner after incident
Regularly test, assess and evaluate effectiveness of security measures
Assess risks to rights and freedoms of natural persons
Implement measures appropriate to the risk level

articles.title: Notification of a personal data breach to the supervisory authority
articles.summary: Controller shall notify personal data breach to supervisory authority without undue delay and, where feasible, within 72 hours.
requirements: Notify supervisory authority within 72 hours of becoming aware of breach
Describe nature of breach (categories and approximate number of data subjects and records)
Provide contact point for more information
Describe likely consequences of breach
Describe measures taken or proposed to address breach
Document all personal data breaches

articles.title: Communication of a personal data breach to the data subject
articles.summary: When breach is likely to result in high risk to rights and freedoms, controller shall communicate breach to data subject without undue delay.
requirements: Communicate breach to data subject when high risk exists
Describe nature of breach in clear and plain language
Provide contact point for more information
Describe likely consequences
Describe measures taken or proposed
No communication required if: technical protection applied (encryption), subsequent measures ensure no high risk, or disproportionate effort (public communication instead)

articles.title: Data protection impact assessment
articles.summary: Where processing is likely to result in high risk, controller shall carry out data protection impact assessment (DPIA).
requirements: Conduct DPIA when processing likely results in high risk
DPIA required for: systematic and extensive evaluation, large-scale processing of special categories, large-scale systematic monitoring of public areas
DPIA shall contain: description of processing operations and purposes, assessment of necessity and proportionality, assessment of risks, measures to address risks
Consult supervisory authority if DPIA indicates high risk

articles.title: Designation of the data protection officer
articles.summary: Controller and processor shall designate data protection officer (DPO) in specific cases.
requirements: Designate DPO when: processing by public authority, core activities require regular and systematic monitoring on large scale, core activities consist of large-scale processing of special categories
Publish contact details of DPO
Communicate DPO contact details to supervisory authority
Ensure DPO is involved in all data protection matters
Ensure DPO has appropriate resources and access to personal data

domains.title: Chapter V - Transfers of Personal Data to Third Countries

articles.title: General principle for transfers
articles.summary: Transfer of personal data to third country or international organisation may only take place if conditions of this Chapter are complied with by controller and processor.
requirements: Ensure level of protection of natural persons is not undermined
Comply with transfer mechanisms under this Chapter

articles.title: Transfers on the basis of an adequacy decision
articles.summary: Transfer may take place where Commission has decided third country ensures adequate level of protection.
requirements: Transfer to third country with adequacy decision does not require specific authorisation

articles.title: Transfers subject to appropriate safeguards
articles.summary: In absence of adequacy decision, controller or processor may transfer data if appropriate safeguards provided and enforceable rights available.
requirements: Use standard contractual clauses adopted by Commission
Use binding corporate rules
Use approved code of conduct with binding enforcement
Use approved certification mechanism with binding commitments

articles.title: Derogations for specific situations
articles.summary: In absence of adequacy decision or appropriate safeguards, transfer may take place only if specific derogation applies.
requirements: Obtain explicit consent after informing of risks
Transfer necessary for performance of contract
Transfer necessary for important reasons of public interest
Transfer necessary for legal claims
Transfer necessary to protect vital interests

articles.title: Supervisory authority
articles.summary: Each Member State shall provide for one or more independent public authorities to be responsible for monitoring application of this Regulation.
requirements: Establish independent supervisory authority
Ensure independence from external influence

articles.title: Powers
articles.summary: Supervisory authority shall have investigative, corrective and authorisation powers.
requirements: Order controller/processor to provide information
Carry out investigations and audits
Access data and premises
Issue warnings and reprimands
Order compliance with data subject requests
Order rectification, erasure or restriction
Impose temporary or definitive processing ban
Impose administrative fines

domains.title: Chapter IX - Specific Data Processing Situations

articles.title: Right to compensation and liability
articles.summary: Any person who has suffered material or non-material damage as result of infringement of this Regulation shall have right to receive compensation.
requirements: Provide compensation for material damage
Provide compensation for non-material damage
Controller involved in processing liable for damage
Processor liable if not complied with obligations or acted outside lawful instructions

articles.title: General conditions for imposing administrative fines
articles.summary: Administrative fines shall be effective, proportionate and dissuasive, up to €20 million or 4% of annual global turnover.
requirements: Lower tier (€10 million or 2%): violations of Articles 8, 11, 25-39, 42, 43
Higher tier (€20 million or 4%): violations of Articles 5, 6, 7, 9, data subject rights, transfer rules, Member State law
Consider: nature, gravity, duration of infringement, intentional or negligent character, actions to mitigate damage, degree of cooperation, previous infringements
